Can I import a wallet using the `importwallet` command without having a wallet dump file?

No, you cannot import a wallet using the `importwallet` command without having a wallet dump file. The `importwallet` command is used to import taddr keys from a wallet dump file, so you need to have a wallet dump file to import from.

importwallet "filename"

Imports taddr keys from a wallet dump file (see dumpwallet).

Arguments:
1. "filename"  (string, required) The wallet file

Examples:

Dump the wallet
> verus dumpwallet "nameofbackup"

Import the wallet
> verus importwallet "path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"

Import using the json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "importwallet", "params": ["path/to/exportdir/nameofbackup"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
